s.text: Book -- Flawed Giant: Lyndon Johnson and His Times 1961-1973 , by Robert Dallek;
Book -- Flawed Giant: Lyndon Johnson and His Times 1961-1973 , by Robert Dallek;
Few summer movies are even trying to duplicate Titanic 's success, the Hollywood press reports.
Few summer movies are even trying to duplicate Titanic 's success, the Hollywood press reports.

Strong performances are credited: Geoffrey Rush uses the prosecutor Javert as a portrait of zealotry, and Liam Neeson makes the prisoner Valjean, a character without a "recognizable human flaw," seem complex (Jay Carr, the Boston Globe ). Others praise the film's slow European pace as an antidote to Hollywood's manic style.
"The studios sensibly scaled down" in the wake of the Christmastime smash hit, says Time 's Richard Corliss.
Scholarly reviewers honor it as "an enduring masterpiece that immediately catches up readers in its transpersonal force and sweep" (Steven Marcus, the New York Times Book Review ).

The 18 th film version of Victor Hugo's novel, this one from Danish director Bille August, wins modest praise despite its familiar story and conventional telling.
